cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 325 mi SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and skirting the Florida east coast toward Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near the southeast Florida coast between Port Everglades and Cape Canaveral

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach FL to Fernandina Beach FL (includes Port Everglades)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Deerfield Beach northward to Savannah River
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (possible sustained 115-130 mph, higher gusts) likely Thursday night through early Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft above ground level possible around Port Everglades due to on-shore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with isolated 10 inch totals possible, producing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents; short-fused tornadoes embedded in rain bands
